revised_title: Evolution of Plant Breeding Systems and Inbreeding Depression
tldr: The authors review population genetic methods applied to the study of plant breeding systems, focusing on the evolution of sexual systems in flowering plants. They emphasize the importance of inbreeding depression as a force opposing the spread of genes that increase selfing rates. The breakdown of distyly and tristyly, types of heterostyly, is also considered, as well as the role of pollination effectiveness and long-distance dispersal in promoting self-fertilization.
